content.description:
Closest accommodation is [De Pakhuys](https://www.depakhuys.com/) But there are lots of options for staying in the pass.

## History

Pakhuis Pass is a 25 km long mountain pass in the northern [Cederberg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cederberg) region of South Africa, built by Thomas Bain between 1875 and 1877. The pass reaches an altitude of 905 m and connects [Clanwilliam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clanwilliam,_South_Africa) to [Calvinia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvinia). It was improved in the 1960s and tarred in 2009. In December 1946, a plane crashed into the nearby Pakhuis Peak, killing everyone on board - The site of the wreckage can still be walked to. The pass features many important San rock paintings, and a handful of popular hiking routes.
